svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
October 23, 2021" date: "2021-10-23"
Eth News and Links
Mainnet execution layer
* PoW switch off community call November 5, for infrastructure providers and
application developers
* Geth v1.10.11 : fixes pending transaction retrieval RPC and snapshot corruption bug
* Stateless Ethereum cheat sheet : current state of verkle trees, address space
extension and state networks
* Piper Merriam’s Aperture Portal Network update : State Network testnet coming,
agreed on a wire protocol, considering using libp2p and an ultra light client in the
browser
EIPs/Standards
* Summary of EIPs for signing and identity , informing EIP4361 Sign-in with Ethereum
Proof of Stake consensus layer
* UPDATE YOUR NODES BEFORE OCT 27 . Danny Ryan’s Finalized reminder: if you don’t
update, you’ll get penalties Teku v21.10.1 : support different ports for TCP and UDP,
fixes Windows incompatibility introduced in v21.10.0 Lighthouse v2.0.1 : fix for
discovery that could cause unexpected shutdown Prysm v2.0.2 : bug fixes Nimbus v1.5.2
: fixes and optimizations
* Teku v21.10.1 : support different ports for TCP and UDP, fixes Windows
incompatibility introduced in v21.10.0
* Lighthouse v2.0.1 : fix for discovery that could cause unexpected shutdown
* Prysm v2.0.2 : bug fixes
* Nimbus v1.5.2
* 46% nodes ready for Altair upgrade ( nodewatch.io )
* Visualization of client diversity change over time. It got worse in the last year,
but is now slowly improving.
* Latest What’s New in Eth2
* PoS implementers call . Notes from Ben Edgington : teams working on issues and
stability of Pithos testnet, Prysm can now sync with Pithos, beacon chain upgrade as
part of PoW switch off needs a name
* Pithos testnet consensus monitor
* Three reorg and liveness attacks on staking fork choice rule
Layer2
* Optimism upgrade to EVM equivalence delayed until November 11
* Celer cBridge v2.0 testnet : improved user experience and LPs have option not to run
a cBridge node, mainnet mid November
* Springrollup proposal for zk rollup where sender can batch unlimited number of
transfers with only 6 bytes of calldata
* Private AMM proposal with weak secrecy using a zkRollup
* Comparison of Arbitrum and Optimism’s fraud proofs
* Systematisation of knowledge of validating bridges [PDF]
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Nexus Mutual !
Yield farming or deploying on L2? Nexus Mutual's Protocol Cover keeps you protected.
Coverage includes all L2 deployments in addition to the regular main chain coverage.
What about multi-chain? We've got you covered for that as well.
Sleep without worrying. Get coverage today.
Stuff for developers
* js-ethereum-cryptography v0.2.0 : cryptographic primitives, 15x smaller with 3
dependencies, experimental, awaiting security audit
* prb-proxy : execute multiple calls in one transaction, modern DSProxy with
deterministic proxy addresses and 3rd party permissions
* smart-batched-auction for ERC721, implementation of Paradigm's NFT launch design
* template-ethereum-contracts : Solidity template with Hardhat deploy, updated with
dapptools tests
* starkex-clientlib-js : JavaScript wrapper of StarkEx API
* starknet-devnet : Flask wrapper of Starknet dummy network
* Ethernal block explorer for private chains, open sourced, adds free and paid
($20/mo) hosted tiers
* pool-sniper : Uniswap v2 pool creation sniper
* 13 lessons from developing USM stable token
Security
* Polygon Plasma bridge double spend vulnerability : $2 million bounty paid Exit
transaction could be resubmitted 223 times ~$850 million was at risk
* $2 million bounty paid
* Exit transaction could be resubmitted 223 times
* ~$850 million was at risk
* Unlock Protocol’s UDT vulnerability , token could be burnt for any address, contract
has since been upgraded
* Indexed Finance identified attacker, details being provided to law enforcement after
expiry of request to return 90% of funds
* Hot wallet private key committed to Git : NFTs rescued via gasless private zero ETH
sales and using Flashbots
Ecosystem
* gasprice.io : gas price estimates with visualizations of recent and monthly prices
and transaction pool analysis
* ETHOnline finalists
* LisCon videos
* Parity 2017 multisig hack of 153k ETH now worth ~$600 million, hacker asked to
return 90% of funds
Enterprise
* Associated Press providing economic, sports and election data via Chainlink
* Facebook’s Novi [PDF] wallet piloting in US and Guatemala with USDP (Paxos) held in
Coinbase Custody
Application layer
* DeFi has $100 billion in TVL
* PoolTogether v4 : single prize pool across Ethereum and sidechains, rather than
siloed
* Worldcoin : iris scans using zk proofs (Semaphore) on Hubble optimistic rollup
* Kwenta testnet futures trading competition
* Decentralized Gitcoin Grants : quadratic funding grants protocol
* Sismo : aggregate reputation on public profile without giving away all your accounts
using zk attestations
* Paperhands : check current floor price of NFTs you sold
* Tellie : creator sites with token gated content
* DAO owning and managing a real life farm
Job Listings
* Team Lead for the Ecosystem Support Program at the Ethereum Foundation
* Senior Engineer @Gitcoin - build the future of public goods funding!
* Solidity is hiring a C++ dev
* Nomic Labs hiring a Tech Lead for Hardhat VSCode
Reach people experienced with Ethereum. $420 for two issues (~75 character limit),
payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to abcoathup.eth. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* New York Attorney General directs two lending platforms to cease activities in New
York and three others to provide info on their activities; failure to redact names
suggests Nexo was sent a cease letter and Celsius was sent an info request
* Australian Senate committee crypto regulation recommendations covering regulatory
structure for DAOs, capital gains tax events and CDBCs
* Epic welcomes games making use of blockchain (unlike Steam)
* NFTs more efficient at signaling cultural fluency than traditional art
* PleasrDAO purchased Wu-Tang Clan’s unreleased album from US DoJ
General
* ECFFT on the BN254 base field implemented in Rust
* Google Threat Analysis Group : phishers target YouTube creators with cookie theft
non-persistent malware in a smash-and-grab
* New York Times: Sneaker flippers using bots
* Argentina’s National Registry of Persons allegedly hacked, identity data of entire
country could be at risk
* 3.1 million email addresses from CoinMarketCap were being traded
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow
@evan_van_ness and @abcoathup to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-october-23-2021/
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new/changes in bold ) :
* Oct 25 - Dec 13 – Gitcoin DAO Global hackathon (virtual)
* Oct 27 – Beacon chain upgrade to Altair epoch 74240 ; EthStaker viewing party
* Oct 28-29 – ETH Portland hackathon
* Nov 1-4 – NFT.NYC
* Nov 5 – PoW switch off community call
* Nov 11 – Optimism upgrade
* Dec ~8 – Arrow Glacier upgrade block 13,773,000
* Jan 24-26 – Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford University)
* Mar 28-30 – ETHDubai
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive it weekly
Week in Ethereum News
